title: The Curious Acorn
hook: One sunny day in the vast forest, a tiny acorn named Alvin wondered what adventures awaited beyond his tree. What could possibly be out there?
moral: Curiosity can lead to wonderful discoveries and friendships.
paragraphs: Alvin lived on a big oak tree, surrounded by his acorn friends. Every day, he watched the birds fly by and listened to the whispers of the wind. But Alvin yearned for something more.
"I wish I could explore the world beyond our tree," Alvin said wistfully. His friends giggled and teased him, "You're just a little acorn, how can you travel far?"
Determined to see the world, Alvin rolled off the tree's branch one morning. As he tumbled down, a friendly squirrel named Sammy caught him. Sammy chuckled, "Where are you off to, little one?"

Alvin sheepishly explained his dream of exploring. Sammy smiled and offered to show him around the forest. Together, they ventured into the unknown, meeting new creatures and marveling at the beauty of nature.
Through his curiosity, Alvin gained new experiences and made a dear friend in Sammy. He realized that the world was full of wonders waiting to be discovered, right in his own backyard.

en-de.title: Der Neugierige Eichel
en-de.moral: Neugier kann zu tollen Entdeckungen und Freundschaften führen.
en-de.hook: An einem sonnigen Tag im großen Wald fragte sich eine winzige Eichel namens Alvin, welche Abenteuer jenseits ihres Baumes auf sie warteten. Was könnte dort wohl sein?
paragraphs:
Alvin wohnte auf einem großen Eichbaum, umgeben von seinen Eichel-Freunden. Jeden Tag beobachtete er die Vögel vorbeifliegen und lauschte den Flüstern des Windes. Aber Alvin sehnte sich nach etwas mehr.
"Ich wünschte, ich könnte die Welt jenseits unseres Baumes erkunden", sagte Alvin sehnsüchtig. Seine Freunde kicherten und neckten ihn, "Du bist nur eine kleine Eichel, wie kannst du weit reisen?"
Bestimmt die Welt zu sehen, rollte Alvin eines Morgens vom Ast des Baumes. Während er hinunter purzelte, fing ihn ein freundliches Eichhörnchen namens Sammy auf. Sammy kicherte, "Wohin gehst du, Kleiner?"
Alvin erklärte schüchtern seinen Traum vom Erkunden. Sammy lächelte und bot ihm an, ihn durch den Wald zu führen. Zusammen wagten sie sich ins Unbekannte, trafen neue Geschöpfe und bestaunten die Schönheit der Natur.
Alvin hatte dank seiner Neugierde neue Erfahrungen gemacht und einen lieben Freund in Sammy gefunden. Er bemerkte, dass die Welt voller Wunder war, die darauf warteten, entdeckt zu werden, direkt in seinem eigenen Hinterhof.

en-pt.title: A Bolinha Curiosa
en-pt.moral: A curiosidade pode levar a descobertas e amizades maravilhosas.
en-pt.hook: Certa vez, num lindo dia na floresta grande, um bolotinha chamado Alvin ficou imaginando quais aventuras o esperavam além de sua árvore. O que será que tem lá fora?
paragraphs:
Alvin morava numa árvore grande de carvalho, cercado pelos seus amigos, as bolotas. Todos os dias, ele via os pássaros voando e ouvia os sussurros do vento. Mas Alvin ansiava por algo mais.
"Eu queria poder explorar o mundo além da nossa árvore", Alvin disse a sonhar. Seus amigos riram e zombaram dele, "Você é apenas uma pequena bolota, como você pode viajar longe?"
Determinado a ver o mundo, Alvin rolou para fora do galho da árvore numa manhã. Enquanto ele caía, um esquilo amigável chamado Sammy o pegou. Sammy riu e perguntou: "Para onde você está indo, pequenino?"
Alvin timidamente contou seu sonho de explorar. Sammy sorriu e se ofereceu para mostrar a floresta a ele. Juntos, eles se aventuraram no desconhecido, conhecendo novas criaturas e se maravilhando com a beleza da natureza.
Com sua curiosidade, Alvin ganhou novas experiências e fez um amigo querido, Sammy. Ele percebeu que o mundo estava cheio de maravilhas esperando para serem descobertas, bem no quintal de sua casa.

en-fr.title: Le Petit Gland Curieux
en-fr.moral: La curiosité peut entraîner de merveilleuses découvertes et amitiés.
en-fr.hook: Un jour ensoleillé dans la grande forêt, un petit gland nommé Alvin se demandait quelles aventures l'attendaient au-delà de son arbre. Qu'est-ce qui pourrait bien se trouver là-bas ?
paragraphs:
Alvin vivait dans un grand chêne, entouré de ses amis les glands. Chaque jour, il regardait les oiseaux passer et écoutait les chuchotements du vent. Mais Alvin désirait quelque chose de plus.
"Je voudrais pouvoir explorer le monde au-delà de notre arbre," Alvin a dit avec nostalgie. Ses amis ont ri et taquiné, "Tu es juste un petit gland, comment peux-tu voyager loin?"
Un matin, Alvin, le petit écureuil qui rêvait de découvrir le monde, est tombé de la branche de l'arbre. En tombant, il a été attrapé par Sammy, un autre écureuil bienveillant. Sammy a ri, en demandant : "Où vas-tu, petit?"
Alvin, timidement, a expliqué son rêve d'exploration. Sammy a souri et lui a proposé de lui montrer la forêt. Ensemble, ils ont bravé l'inconnu, rencontrant de nouvelles créatures et s'émerveillant de la beauté de la nature.
Avec sa curiosité, Alvin a vécu de nouvelles aventures et s'est fait un cher ami en Sammy. Il a réalisé que le monde était rempli de merveilles qui attendaient d'être découvertes, juste dans son propre jardin.

paragraphs:
Alvin lived on a huge tree with his acorn buddies. Each day, he saw birds and heard wind whispers. But Alvin wanted more.
Alvin said sadly, "I wish I could see what's outside our home tree." 
His pals laughed and teased, "You're only a small nut, can you journey so distant?"
Alvin wanted to explore the big world, so one day he rolled off the tree's branch. Luckily, a nice squirrel named Sammy caught him as he fell. Sammy asked, "Where are you going, little friend?"
Alvin was a little shy when he shared his big dream of exploring. Sammy, with a big smile, said he would guide him through the forest. They went on an adventure together, discovering new animals and being amazed by the wonderful nature.
Alvin was very curious. He found new adventures and made a special friend named Sammy. Alvin discovered that there are many amazing things to find in his own yard.
